ponderforkc.ponder.stockpot.text_1: To cook with a Stockpot, place it on a valid heat source
ponderforkc.ponder.stockpot.text_2: First, add soupbase to the Stockpot
ponderforkc.ponder.stockpot.text_3: Next, add the required ingredients for the recipe
ponderforkc.ponder.stockpot.text_4: After confirming the recipe is correct, cover the Stockpot with its lid
ponderforkc.ponder.pot.text_1: To cook with a pot, place it on a valid heat source
ponderforkc.ponder.pot.text_2: First, heat the oil in the pot!
ponderforkc.ponder.pot.text_3: Next, add the required ingredients for cooking
ponderforkc.ponder.pot.text_4: After confirming the recipe is correct, start stir-frying!
ponderforkc.ponder.steamer.text_1: To cook with a Steamer, place it on a valid heat source
ponderforkc.ponder.steamer.text_2: Place another steamer on top of an existing one to stack them upward...
ponderforkc.ponder.steamer.text_4: However, a single heat source can only provide heat for up to 8 steamers...
ponderforkc.ponder.steamer.text_5: ...so, be mindful of the stacking limit
ponderforkc.ponder.steamer_1.text_1: Place the ingredients to be steamed into the steamer from the top
ponderforkc.ponder.steamer_1.text_2: You can also directly stack steamers that already contain ingredients
ponderforkc.ponder.steamer_1.text_3: After placing, cover the steamer to start cooking
ponderforkc.ponder.steamer_1.text_4: Then, wait for a period of time...
ponderforkc.ponder.steamer_1.text_5: Once cooking is complete, remove the steamer lid...
ponderforkc.ponder.steamer_1.text_6: ...and finally, remove the steamers and the finished products layer by layer
ponderforkc.ponder.enamel_basin.text_1: Open the enamel basin lid to store oil
ponderforkc.ponder.enamel_basin.text_2: Using a KitchenShovel, you can take out 1 portion of oil from the enamel basin...
ponderforkc.ponder.enamel_basin.text_3: ...then you can use the greased KitchenShovel to add oil to a pot
ponderforkc.ponder.millstone.text_1: Right-click the millstone with items to be processed in hand to place them into the millstone
ponderforkc.ponder.millstone.text_2: Items dropped above the millstone will also be automatically placed into it
ponderforkc.ponder.millstone.text_3: The millstone will automatically bind to nearby creatures
ponderforkc.ponder.millstone.text_4: After binding a creature, the millstone begins to work...
ponderforkc.ponder.millstone.text_5: ...after one full rotation, the material is transformed into products and ejected from the opening
ponderforkc.ponder.shawarma_spit.text_1: First, place ingredients into both the upper and lower layers of the Shawarma Spit
ponderforkc.ponder.shawarma_spit.text_2: Each layer can hold up to 8 identical smeltable food items
ponderforkc.ponder.shawarma_spit.text_3: Provide a Redstone signal to activate the spit and start cooking
ponderforkc.ponder.shawarma_spit.text_4: Then, just wait for a period of time...
ponderforkc.ponder.shawarma_spit.text_6: However, removing food directly by hand from an activated Shawarma Spit will cause burns
ponderforkc.ponder.shawarma_spit.text_7: The correct method is to use a KitchenKnife to remove the food...
ponderforkc.ponder.shawarma_spit.text_8: ...or first deactivate the Redstone signal powering the spit before attempting to remove the food
ponderforkc.ponder.recipe_item.text_1: Right-clicking a Pot or Stockpot containing ingredients with a blank Recipe in hand will record the currently added materials and cooking result into the Recipe
ponderforkc.ponder.recipe_item.text_2: Right-clicking a Pot or Stockpot with a recorded Recipe in hand will automatically add the materials from your inventory that are listed in the Recipe into the pot
ponderforkc.ponder.tag.kitchen_blocks.de: Embark on the path to becoming a culinary master!
